"About that beer I owed ya! It's me Gordon, Squidward from Black Mesa" (Uncle Al).

Good graphics for a game made in 2004, Probably one of the best older games I've played.
Some parts were kind of tedious like certain areas where you have to do parkour. Gravity gun was fun to use, especially with the upgrade at the end. Also ending was easier / better than half life 1. Never figured out what happened to Lamar though. 
Best half-life game so far.

The levels have incredible flow, and the combat is inventive. Difficult to explain how but you get a real sense of travelling distances, more so than your average modern 'open world' rpg. It's also a great game to pop on when you haven't got a ton of free time and you just want to a quick run through.

I could go on for hours but I'd keep it short. This game is really good. The combat is fun, the story is amazing, the atmosphere is gripping and the puzzles are challenging. Almost everything about it is good. From how you get to an almost completely looking planet in every chapter and having to swicth up your guns every 10 seconds in combat. This game is the highest rated pc game of all time and it deserves that title. Although I do have some criticisms like how some chapters look dull and are boring to get through. (Looking at you Entanglement) and the story elements have awful replayability. Other than that this game is brilliant. A must play for everyone and never gets old.

Hard to praise this game enough. It revolutionised FPS games.
Fun puzzles, fast paced shooting sequences, driving missions, looting, and a great story.
A few slightly tedious moments but I never felt burned out playing this game.
Would recommend to any FPS fans wanting to play a classic that without a doubt had some influence on their favourite new games.
